4a1709fc558601d050f61caacf1886f7.description: Attribute designed to capture the generalized age grouping (commonly referred to as "stage") of a given baby food, as specified by manufacturer. Example descriptions: Stage 1 -  Foods have a single ingredient and are pureed and generally contain about 2.5 oz  of fruits, veggies or meats. Stage 2  -  Foods are strained instead of pureed and have a combination of fruits or veggies instead of single ingredients, contain larger portions. Stage 3  -  Foods are mashed and have more texture than the pureed foods and may have bits and chunks of meats or veggies.
